item.title: About Me
item.description:
WIP

I have 5+ years of experience designing, coding, and simulating autonomous micro aerial vehicles. During my study and research, I developed a great interest in perception-related tasks and algorithms, as well as data-driven and learning-based methods of solving practical problems. Now, my main interests are 3D vision/SLAM/VIO, ML/AI, and image/video processing. Click me to download my CV.

Experience

Master’s Student in Aerospace Engineering

Delft University of Technology · Full-time
Sep 2022 - Present
Delft, South Holland, Netherlands

Program profile: Control and Simulation

Research Assistant

Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen · Part-time
Mar 2021 - Sep 2021
nROS-lab, Shenzhen, China

Project video demo: Omnihex

Click me for more information

I made a drone that can hover at any orientation:

  • Released a PX4-Autopilot firmware optimized for over-actuated hexacopters by reworking the flight control algorithm, flight mode manager, and control allocation algorithm
  • Created a digital twin of our hexacopter (in SDFormat) and wrote ROS2 plugins for doing software-in-the-loop Gazebo simulation
  • Built an over-actuated hexacopter from scratch using the Solidworks software, 3D printing and CNC machining technics
  • Implemented ROS2-PX4 wrappers for Dynamixel servos and the OptiTrack indoor motion-capturing system

My work has also been used as a basic building component in 2 other lab projects researching trajectory planning of over-actuated drones

Publications

Adaptive Nonlinear MPC for Trajectory Tracking of An Overactuated Tiltrotor Hexacopter

arXiv · Nov 12, 2022

Link to: paper

Collision-Free 6-DoF Trajectory Generation for Omnidirectional Multi-rotor Aerial Vehicle

arXiv · Sep 14, 2022

Link to: paper

RGB-D Inertial Odometry for a Resource-Restricted Robot in Dynamic Environments

IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters · Jul 15, 2022

Link to: paper, code

Projects

The Maze Runner: MAV Collision-Free Navigation in Cyberzoo

Mar 2023 - Apr 2023

Link to: code

Click me for more information

This is a coursework project for AE4317 Autonomous Flight of MAVs. We propose a way to guide the Bebop drone towards a goal waypoint while making it avoid obstacles in the Cyberzoo, using monocular dense optical flow and image gradient calculations.

Solving Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows

Nov 2022 - Dec 2022

Link to: code

Click me for more information

Course project Operations Optimization (AE4441)

Wheeled Robot Navigation on Color & Perspective

Oct 2021 - Nov 2021

Link to: code

Click me for more information

Visual-Servo Jenga Manipulator

Link to: code

Click me for more information

Course project Introduction to Robotics

Autonomous Delivery Drone

Link to: code, 百度贴吧

Home-made, super cheap autonomous antenna tracker for long-range FPV flights.

Education

Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen

Bachelor’s degree, Mechatronics, Robotics, and Automation Engineering
Sep 2018 - Jul 2022
Grade: Cum Laude 88/100

Activities and societies: RoboMaster Critical-HIT(南工晓鹰), HITSZ Chorus(艺术团合唱部), nROS-lab(网络机器人与系统实验室)

Guangdong Experimental High School

High School Diploma, Natural Sciences
Sep 2015 - Jul 2018
Grade: Gaokao 620/750

Activities and societies: GEH Aerospace Association(广东实验中学航空社团)
